array.string: BIG BANG : Formation of the Universe
The Big Bang theory is the cosmological model for the earliest known periods of the universe. It states that the Universe was in a very high density state and then expanded.
Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is also the largest of the Solar System's four terrestrial planets
CAMBRIAN : Explosion of Life on Earth
The Cambrian Period marked a profound change in life on Earth; prior to the Cambrian, living organisms on the whole were small, unicellular and simple.
The Permian witnessed the diversification of the early amniotes into the ancestral groups of the mammals. It ended with the largest mass extinction in Earth's history.
The Mesoic period also called the age of reptiles, it was dominated by reptiles such as Iguanodon, Megalosaurus, Plesiosaurus and what are now called Pseudosuchia.
The Cenozoic is also known as the Age of Mammals, because the extinction of many groups allowed mammals to greatly diversify.
